result.execSummary:
The defendant David W Liethen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.

All financials same as noted above.
Defendant to submit DNA sample at Sheriff's Dept.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David W Liethen

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Shawano Co DNA Proof of Submission - DNA obtained

Defendant David W Liethen in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Right to counsel given - defendant proceeds w/o counsel.  Court accepts waiver of attorney for now as he doesn't qualify for the PD.  Defendant enters a plea of no contest.  Court advises party of their rights, finds factual basis, accepts defendant's waiver of their rights, the plea made, and finds guilty.  Citizenship and probation info provided.  DA recommends $100+ costs and DNA sample.  Defendant makes a statement.  Court orders recommendation.  Appeal rights.

Defendant David W Liethen in court.  Scott E. Niemi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  DA recommends $100 + costs & DNA sample.  Right to counsel given - defendant wishes to speak with an attorney.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
